intro: Ebenus cilicica, commonly known as the Cilician spurge, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in rocky or arid environments. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, and its leaves are usually lance-shaped with a rough texture. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. Ebenus cilicica is often found in scrublands and open woodlands, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
